act_name: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005

definition_domestic_violence.3: Domestic violence includes physical abuse, sexual abuse, verbal/emotional abuse, economic abuse
definition_domestic_violence.3A: Physical abuse - Assault, criminal force, endangering life/health
definition_domestic_violence.3B: Sexual abuse - Forced sexual acts, pornography
definition_domestic_violence.3C: Verbal/emotional abuse - Insults, ridicule, humiliation, threats
definition_domestic_violence.3D: Economic abuse - Deprivation of resources, preventing employment, disposal of property

right_to_reside.17: Right to reside in shared household - Woman cannot be evicted from matrimonial home
right_to_reside.18: Right to reside even if no ownership - Irrespective of title, woman has right to live
right_to_reside.19: Protection against dispossession - Cannot be thrown out without court order

protection_orders.18: Protection order - Prohibit respondent from committing acts of domestic violence
protection_orders.19: Residence order - Woman can continue to reside, respondent may be asked to leave
protection_orders.20: Monetary relief - Compensation for injuries, medical expenses, loss of earnings, maintenance
protection_orders.21: Custody order - Temporary custody of children to aggrieved person
protection_orders.22: Compensation order - Damages for mental torture and emotional distress
protection_orders.23: Interim/ex-parte orders - Immediate relief in urgent cases

procedure.12: Application to Magistrate - Can be filed by woman or Protection Officer
procedure.13: Notice to respondent - Within 2 days of application
procedure.14: Counseling - Magistrate may refer to counseling
procedure.15: Medical examination - Court can order medical examination
procedure.26: Relief can be sought along with other proceedings - Divorce, maintenance, custody

penalties.31: Breach of protection order - Imprisonment up to 1 year or fine up to Rs.20,000 or both
penalties.32: Cognizable and non-bailable offense - Police must register FIR and arrest

support_services.8: Protection Officers - Appointed by State Government to assist victims
support_services.9: Service providers - Shelter homes, medical facilities, legal aid
support_services.10: Duties of police - Register complaint, assist in medical examination, provide information about rights

maintenance.20A: Monetary relief includes maintenance for wife and children
maintenance.20B: Amount based on income and needs
